page.title: 07SHALLOWFORD RETREAT CENTRE
page.content: A benefactor gave Shallowford House to the Diocese of Lichfield in 1938, to be used as a Diocesan Retreat Centre. In 1973 it was modernised and can now accommodate up to 39 people. It is mainly intended as a centre to which clergy and laity may come in groups for relaxation, renewal and study. The house is also equipped for conferences, parish weekends or meetings. Non-diocesan groups, too, may use the facilities. The lounge and library are the two main meeting rooms. The Priest from nearby Chebsey regularly conducts a service in the Chapel. Upstairs, the Diocesan Education Office has a Resources Centre.
